tetra.general.geodegenerate.tooltip: Toggle off to disable generation of geodes. Already generated chunks may still contain geodes. §oRequires restart.§r
tetra.general.generatefeatures.tooltip: Enables generation of terrain features such as ancient ruins. Will not remove already generated features when disabled. §oRequires restart.§r
tetra.general.maxfeaturedepth.tooltip: Used to limit how deep the feature generator will recurse into feature children, helps to avoid recursive loops and cascading worldgen in 3d-party generation features.
tetra.general.development.tooltip: Puts tetra in development mode, causing several configuration files to be reloaded continously and initializes rendering of structure helpers. Enabling will have a negative impact on performance. §oRequires restart.§r
tetra.general.moduleprogression.tooltip: Allows tetra items to "level up" after being used a certain amount of times, allowing the player to choose from different ways to "hone" 1 module on the item. Major modules also settle after some time, increasing its integrity.
tetra.general.workbenchdroptable.tooltip: Enabling cause the workbench to drop itself as an item when broken, rather than dropping the vanilla crafting bench.
tetra.general.settlelimitbase.tooltip: The base value for number of uses required for a module to settle.
tetra.general.settlelimitlevelmultiplier: Level multiplier for settling limit. A value of 3 would cause a module that has settled once to require 3x as many uses before it settles again.
tetra.general.settlelimitdurabilitymulti: Durability multiplier for settling limit. A value of 1 would cause a module with 75 durability to require an additional 75 uses before it settles.
tetra.general.honeswordbase.tooltip: The base value for number of uses required before a sword can be honed.
tetra.general.honeswordintegritymultipli: Integrity multiplier for sword honing. A value of 2 would cause a sword which uses 3 integrity to require a 2*3 times as many uses before it can be honed.
tetra.general.honeduplexbase.tooltip: The base value for number of uses required before a tool can be honed.
tetra.general.honeduplexintegritymultipl: Integrity multiplier for tool honing. A value of 2 would cause a sword which uses 3 integrity to require a 2*3 times as many uses before it can be honed.

basic_blade_schema.name: Simple blade
basic_blade_schema.description: Replace the current sword blade with the given blade, or reforge it using raw materials.

serrated_blade_schema.name: Serrate
serrated_blade_schema.description: Serrates the blade, providing a saw-tooth edged blade. Has a 30%% chance to cause the target to bleed for 4 damage over 2 seconds. Not effective against undead.
blade_hone_serrated_2_schema.name: Hone: Serrated II
blade_hone_serrated_2_schema.description: Hone the serrated improvement, increases the damage dealt to 8.

blade_hone_serrated_3_schema.description: Further hone the serrated improvement, increases the damage dealt to 16.

tempered_blade_schema.description: Temper the point of the blade, greatly increasing it's hardness. Causes some of the damage dealt to ignore armor.
blade_hone_tempered_2_schema.name: Hone: Tempered II
blade_hone_tempered_2_schema.description: Hone the tempered improvement, increases the amount of damage that penetrates armor to 3.
blade_hone_tempered_3_schema.name: Hone: Tempered III
blade_hone_tempered_3_schema.description: Further hone the serrated improvement, increases the amount of damage that penetrates armor to 5.
hooked_blade_schema.name: Carve hook
hooked_blade_schema.description: Carve a hook into the back side of the blade, providing additional damage when hitting unsuspecting enemies. Cause critical strikes when attacking enemies from behind.
blade_hone_hooked_2_schema.name: Hone: Hooked II
blade_hone_hooked_2_schema.description: Hone the hooked improvement, increases the bonus damage dealt when hitting enemies from behind to 75%%.
blade_hone_hooked_3_schema.name: Hone: Hooked III
blade_hone_hooked_3_schema.description: Further hone the hooked improvement, increases the bonus damage dealt when hitting enemies from behind to 125%%.

sword/makeshift_guard.description: A sword guard, its weak construction provides little protection for the wielding hand.

sword/wide_guard.description: a wide guard which protects the wielding hand. Provides additional armor when the sword is held in the main-hand or off-hand.

sword_socket_schema.description: Socket a gem into the sword, providing different effects depending on the gem.
sword/socket.name: Socket
sword/socket.description: A gem, fitted onto the sword where the blade meets the hilt. The gem is enchanted and provides magical boons to the wielder of the sword.
sword_socket/pristine_diamond.descriptio: A gem, fitted onto the sword where the blade meets the hilt. The gem is enchanted and provides magical boons to the wielder of the sword.\n\nThe gem is of pristine quality and provides improved effects compared to a gem of lesser quality.
sword_socket/pristine_emerald.descriptio: A gem, fitted onto the sword where the blade meets the hilt. The gem is enchanted and provides magical boons to the wielder of the sword.\n\nThe gem is of pristine quality and provides improved effects compared to a gem of lesser quality.
sword_socket/pristine_lapis.description: A gem, fitted onto the sword where the blade meets the hilt. The gem is enchanted and provides magical boons to the wielder of the sword.\n\nThe gem is of pristine quality and provides improved effects compared to a gem of lesser quality.
counterweight_schema.name: Counterweight
counterweight_schema.description: Balance the blade with a counterweight. Greatly increases attack speed if the counterweight consumes the same amount of integrity as all other modules combined. If integrity usage differs the bonus is reduced, a large difference reduces the bonus further and may even reduce the attack speed.
sword/counterweight.name: Counterweight
sword/counterweight.description: A counterweight attached to the bottom of the hilt. Greatly increases attack speed if the counterweight consumes the same amount of integrity as all other modules combined. If integrity usage differs the bonus is reduced, a large difference reduces the bonus further and may even reduce the attack speed.
reinforced_fuller_schema.name: Reinforce fuller
reinforced_fuller_schema.description: Reinforce the fuller using the given material. Provides additional integrity and reduces the chance for the item to take damage, but makes the sword heavier and slower to swing.
sword/reinforced_fuller.name: Reinforced fuller
sword/reinforced_fuller.description: A fuller reinforcement that provides additional integrity and reduces the chance for the item to take damage, but makes the sword heavier and slower to swing.
sword_binding_schema.name: Binding
sword_binding_schema.description: Tighten the binding between the hilt and the blade by wrapping it with rope or straps, or by using completely different materials and methods.
sword/binding.name: Binding
sword_binding/string.description: Tightly bound strings strengthens the blade's attachment to the hilt.
sword_binding/leather.description: Tightly bound leather straps strengthens the blade's attachment to the hilt.
sword_binding/hide.description: Tightly bound hide straps strengthens the blade's attachment to the hilt.
sword_binding/vine.description: Tightly bound vine straps strengthens the blade's attachment to the hilt.
sword_binding/bolt.description: An adjustable bolt attaches the blade to the hilt.
sword_tweak/binding_bolt.label: Bolt tightness
sword_tweak/binding_bolt.tooltip: §eTighten§r the bolt to make the sword more stiff, increasing damage.\n§eLoosen§r the bolt to allow for a softer rebound, effectively increasing durability.

toolbelt_belt0.name: Woolen sash
toolbelt_belt0.description: A rope and some leather scraps proved to be a great way to gain easy access to one of your tools, but the rope lacks the strength to support additional tools. Weaving a sash out of wool should provide better support than simply tying a rope around your waist.
toolbelt_belt1.name: Leather wrap
toolbelt_belt1.description: With the proper tools at hand you should be able to cut leather into a long strap, which should prove even stronger than a belt fashioned from wool.
toolbelt_belt2.name: Belt buckle
toolbelt_belt2.description: A buckle instead of a knot should provide additional support for carrying things around your waist.
toolbelt_belt3.name: Shulker inlay
toolbelt_belt3.description: Shulker shells proved exceptional as support when carrying chests, inlaying shells into the belt should further increase it's integrity.
toolbelt/belt.name: Toolbelt
belt/rope.name: Rope
belt/rope.description: A very basic waistband fashioned from a rope. Can hold a very limited amount of attachments.
belt/sash.name: Wool sash
belt/sash.description: A woolen sash that can hold a small amount of attachments.
belt/leather.name: Leather wrap
belt/leather.description: A sturdy leather strap that can be wrapped around ones waist. Can hold a decent amount of attachments.
belt/buckled.name: Leather belt
belt/buckled.description: A sturdy leather belt, locked in place with a buckle. Can hold a large amount of attachments.
belt/inlaid.name: Shulker inlaid belt
belt/inlaid.description: A sturdy leather belt that has been inlaid with shulker shells. Can hold an impressive amount of attachments.
strap_schema1.name: Single belt strap
strap_schema1.description: Attach a single strap to the belt, which can be used for carrying and quickly accessing tools or other items.
strap_schema2.name: Double belt strap

strap_schema3.name: Triple belt strap
strap_schema3.description: Attach three straps to the belt, which can be used for carrying and quickly accessing tools or other items.
strap_schema4.name: Quadruple belt strap
strap_schema4.description: Attach four straps to the belt, which can be used for carrying and quickly accessing tools or other items.
strap1/leather.name: Leather strap
strap1/leather.description: A leather strap that can be used to hang an item off the belt, allowing quick access to a frequently used tool or weapon.
strap1/iron.name: Iron loop
strap1/iron.description: An iron loop that can be used to hang an item off the belt, allowing quick access to a frequently used tool or weapon.
strap2/leather.name: 2 Leather straps
strap2/leather.description: Two leather straps that can be used to hang items off the belt, allowing quick access to frequently used tools or weapons.
strap2/iron.name: 2 Iron loops
strap2/iron.description: Two iron loops that can be used to hang items off the belt, allowing quick access to frequently used tools or weapons.
strap3/leather.name: 3 Leather straps

strap3/iron.name: 3 Iron loops
strap3/iron.description: Three iron loops that can be used to hang items off the belt, allowing quick access to frequently used tools or weapons.
strap4/leather.name: 4 Leather straps

potion_storage_schema.name: Potion bag
potion_storage_schema.description: Attach a small bag specifically designed for carrying potions. The bag stores a large amount of potions, but can only support a small set of different types of potions.
toolbelt/potion_storage.name: Potion bag
toolbelt/potion_storage.description: A small bag specifically designed for carrying potions. The bag stores a large amount of potions, but can only support a small set of different types of potions.
storage_schema.name: Storage pouch
storage_schema.description: Attach a small pouch to the toolbelt, which can store a decent amount of items. The contents of the pouch are not available using the toolbelt's quick access functionality.
toolbelt/storage.name: Storage pouch
toolbelt/storage.description: A small pouch which can store a decent amount of items. The contents of the pouch are not available using the toolbelt's quick access functionality.
quiver_schema.name: Quiver
quiver_schema.description: Attach a quiver to the toolbelt. The quiver can hold a large amount of arrows.
toolbelt/quiver.name: Quiver
toolbelt/quiver.description: A quiver that can hold a large amount of arrows.
booster_schema.name: Booster
booster_schema.description: Attach a booster unit, which grants the ability to jump long distances or even fly for shorter periods of time. Activate by crouching before a jump, or by jumping mid air or while flying with an elytra. §oUses gunpowder from toolbelt inventories as fuel.
toolbelt/booster.name: Booster
toolbelt/booster.description: A booster unit which grants the ability to jump long distances or even fly for shorter periods of time. Activate by crouching before a jump, or by jumping mid air or while flying with an elytra. §oUses gunpowder from toolbelt inventories as fuel.
strap_quickslot_schema.name: Quick latch
strap_quickslot_schema.description: Using a quick latch mechanism for locking the strap in place allows faster access to the tool held by the strap.\n\n§7Tapping the toolbelt access hotkey will attempt to equip the first item suitable for breaking or salvaging the block you're looking at. Tools can only be equipped from slots with this upgrade.
strap/quick_latch.name: Quick latch
strap/quick_latch.description: Tapping the toolbelt hotkey will quickly equip the most suitable tool from this inventory.
quiver_quickslot_schema.name: Quick latch
quiver_quickslot_schema.description: Upgrade the quiver with a quick latch mechanism, allowing quicker access to arrows in the quiver.\n\n§7Drawing a bow with no ammo available will automatically grab an arrow from the first stack in the quiver.
quiver/quick_latch.name: Quick latch
quiver/quick_latch.description: Arrows will be automatically drawn from this quiver when no ammo is available.
storage_quickslot_schema.name: Quick latch
storage_quickslot_schema.description: Upgrade the pouch with a quick latch mechanism, making it easier to stash items into it.\n\n§7Held items can be put into the pouch using the restock hotkey.
storage/quick_latch.name: Quick latch
storage/quick_latch.description: Held items can be stashed into the pouch using the restock hotkey.

    "item.tetra.scroll.warforge.details": "§l§nWarforging§r\n\nWarforging a double headed tool makes it much more effective in combat, this provides:\n\n + a §lpassive§r stat or effect based on the warforged head\n\n + a right-click §lability§r based on the left head\n\n + an ability §lmodifier§r based on the right head\r§l§nBattleaxes§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Severing\nAttacks have a chance to reduce the target's max health\n\n§lAbility:§r Execute\nDeals bonus damage based on missing health and harmful effects\n\n§lModifier:§r Overcharge\nAbilities can be charged up further to increase damage and improve effects\r§l§nWarhammers§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Crushing\nAttacks partially bypass armor and absorption effects\n\n§lAbility:§r Slam\nAttack a single target with a strong knockback, or hit multiple enemies in a large area\n\n§lModifier:§r Momentum\nCauses abilities to stun targets or knock them back further\r§l§nWar-picks§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Skewering\nAttacks deal bonus damage to unarmored targets\n\n§lAbility:§r Puncture\nReduces the target's armor or cause them to bleed\n\n§lModifier:§r Combo\nGain combo points from regular attacks which improves abilities\r§l§nTool butts§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Light\nProvides a significant speed increase but reduces the tier of the tool\n\n§lAbility:§r None\n\n§lModifier:§r Light\nReduces ability charge time and cooldown\r§l§nClaws§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Armor pen.\nAttacks partially ignore armor\n\n§lAbility:§r Pry\nApplies a stacking armor reduction effect on the target\n\n§lModifier:§r Revenge\nImproves abilities when the wielder is at a disadvantage\r§l§nGuisarmes (hoes)§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Damage bonus\nIncreases overall weapon damage\n\n§lAbility:§r Overpower\nDeals high damage but exhausts both the target and the wielder\n\n§lModifier:§r Overextend\nAbilities are more effective but drains additional food\r§l§nWarsickles§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Sweeping\nIncreased sweep damage and range\n\n§lAbility:§r Reap\nHits targets in an area, kills empower the wielder\n\n§lModifier:§r Exhilaration\nEmpowers abilities when used successfully\r§l§nBattleadzes§r\n\n§lPassive:§r Damage bonus\nSignificantly increases damage for the adze head\n\n§lAbility:§r Lunge\nLunge forward and deal damage to the first target hit\n\n§lModifier:§r Defensive\nAbilities grant defensive bonuses when the item is used in the offhand",
